entry.title: I Still Remember
entry.summary:
Author: Murmeloni

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,852Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 71

Summary: Clark proposes to his girlfriend of a few months and asks Bruce to be the best man at their wedding. Bruce thinks that might just be one of the worst things to ever happen to him, but of course he agrees. It's only one day, he tells himself, it'll be over soon. Except it's not. Because Bat-Mite doesn't like to see his favorite hero sad...

entry.title: Super Freak
entry.summary:
Author: Holdt

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,787Chapters: 3/12Kudos: 2

Summary: They have an arrangement. Eight months of Thursdays. Eight months of Bruce cataloguing everything he tells himself he's not cataloguing — the sounds Clark makes, the impossible heat of him, the way his sleeping body turns toward Bruce's corner of the room. Eight months of very carefully not calling it what it is. Then Clark shows up on a Sunday and asks Bruce what he knows. Turns out Bruce knows exactly what this is. He's known since Kazakhstan, since a restaurant at 3 AM, since Clark said I'd like to come back from this to a bowl of pelmeni and Bruce filed it under highest priority classification and declined to retrieve it. He's retrieving it now. (Or: Bruce Wayne's comprehensive manual on how to be in love with Clark Kent while pretending very hard that you're not, until you can't pretend anymore, at which point you should probably just say it out loud. Featuring: a case, a conspiracy, water rights journalism, one teenager's homemade piezometers, and Bruce Wayne learning that sometimes staying is scarier than any exit he's ever built.)

entry.title: No Ragrets
entry.summary:
Author: capricious_Bastard

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,631Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 11

Summary: "I love cake on a pan, it's my favourite." Bruce lets out a faux -surprised gasp even as he remains still, expression neutral as he watches the batter cook. "What? I can't believe I'm just learning about this; what's next, you'll tell me that you like black coffee too?" Clark raises his head, nuzzles his nose to Bruce's cheek, "I do, actually. But nothing beats milk with breakfast."

entry.title: Cryptomnesia
entry.summary:
Author: CurlyQ

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,870Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 11

Summary: “Uh hi! Apologies for the intrusion, I’m Clark Kent with the Daily Planet, I just wanted to know if you might give me a quote on the van that attempted to run you and your colleagues over.” “Looks like you pretty much got the gist of it. I gotta thank you for the school teacher cover, it’s giving me an excuse to leave right now.” Clark gave a bewildered look as if he was trying to feign ignorance. “Drop the act. I may have almost been run over but that doesn’t mean I lost my eyes and ears in the process. A school teacher calling a hospital? Really?” Clark fixed his glasses, a small chuckle escaping his lips. “It’s true what they say then, you’re pretty good.” “Not sure if I would call doing my job ‘pretty good,’ but that’s why you’re the reporter and I’m the detective. Now if you’ll excuse me...” Bruce Wayne has it all: a solid career, a family fortune, but what happens when a huge conspiracy falls right into his lap and he suddenly finds himself in a load of trouble and no one but a rookie reporter to help him out?

entry.title: Clinging to What's Lost
entry.summary:
Author: Dracula4life

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,003Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 61

Summary: Jason Todd thought he had moved past the pain of his past. Willis and Catherine were far behind him, along with the Joker and a year of torture. But when Jason comes home to his husband Roy overdosing on the couch, he realizes that the life he worked for was falling from his fingertips with each passing moment."Jason considered himself a pretty happy person. He lived with his charming husband Roy, and their adorable daughter Lian, and Jason went to Wayne Manor every Sunday for dinner. He and Bruce were as close as they could be, and Jason called his siblings every few weeks to catch up. Alfred was getting older, but Jason would still visit to help cook. Jason’s joking reference to Clark as ‘Pops’ had turned less sarcastic with each remark.So of course something had to screw things up."

entry.summary:
Author: PurpleButterfly19

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 574Chapters: 1/39Kudos: 14

Summary: It’s been three years since Dick and Kori got married, and many things have changed for the Kent-Wayne family.The family grew larger through more adoptions and also biological ties. New soulmates were discovered, more weddings were held, the Justice League can finally put a name to the man behind the cowl, and Wayne Manor will never look the same again. But the greatest change? Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent are officially engaged.This is the story of how they got there.As for Conner? He couldn’t be doing any better!

entry.title: Seven minutes in heaven
entry.summary:
Author: SubtleSolstice

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 241,717Chapters: 36/?Kudos: 760

Summary: Dick Grayson thought it would be harmless, one chill night where the Young Justice crew and the Titans could actually relax together. No missions. No explosions. Just friends, laughter… and maybe a little too much alcohol. But when a round of Never Have I Ever spirals into Seven Minutes in Heaven, Dick and Wally find themselves a little too close in the dark — and suddenly, nothing feels simple anymore. Or;Wally and Dick’s developing relationship, full of tension, tenderness, and the two of them absolutely failing to keep their hands to themselves.

entry.title: Sanatorium
entry.summary:
Author: riversiders

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,380Chapters: 4/20Kudos: 55

Summary: They're forcing Bruce to rest. Tucked away on the Kents' farm in rural Kansas with Superman as his keeper, he has little choice but to cooperate. At least Dick is happy—happier. It's good for him to be around normal, well-adjusted people. They can be there for him in ways Bruce is incapable of. The more he reads of his mother's journal, the more certain he becomes; Bruce Wayne was never destined to be part of a happy family. Meanwhile, back in Gotham, the Batclub's hard at work. It'll be a dirty job, bringing Thomas Elliot to justice. Luckily, Lois, Harvey, and Selina are perfectly comfortable with the morally grey.
